Title: ICU: Integer overflow
Synopsis:
An integer overflow flaw in ICU could possibly allow for the
    execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: ICU is a mature, widely used set of C/C++ and Java libraries providing Unicode and Globalization support for software applications.

Description.Text: It was discovered that ICUâ€™s UnicodeString::doAppend() function is vulnerable to an integer overflow. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for more details.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted string in an application linked against ICU, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All ICU users should upgrade to the latest version:
